content.paragraph1: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a comprehensive data protection law that applies to all organizations processing personal data of individuals in the European Union and European Economic Area.
content.paragraph2: This page explains your rights under GDPR and how PayMatch ensures compliance with these regulations.

rightToInformation.title: 2.1 Right to Information
rightToInformation.content: You have the right to be informed about the collection and use of your personal data, including the purposes of processing and retention periods.

rightOfAccess.title: 2.2 Right of Access
rightOfAccess.content: You have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning you is being processed and, if so, access to that data.

rightToRectification.title: 2.3 Right to Rectification
rightToRectification.content: You have the right to have inaccurate personal data corrected and incomplete personal data completed.

rightToErasure.title: 2.4 Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
rightToErasure.content: You have the right to have your personal data erased in certain circumstances, such as when the data is no longer necessary for the original purpose.

rightToRestrictProcessing.title: 2.5 Right to Restrict Processing
rightToRestrictProcessing.content: You have the right to restrict the processing of your personal data in certain circumstances.

rightToDataPortability.title: 2.6 Right to Data Portability
rightToDataPortability.content: You have the right to receive your personal data in a structured, commonly used format and to transmit that data to another controller.

rightToObject.title: 2.7 Right to Object
rightToObject.content: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data for certain purposes, including direct marketing.

rightsRelatedToAutomatedDecisionMaking.title: 2.8 Rights Related to Automated Decision Making
rightsRelatedToAutomatedDecisionMaking.content: You have the right not to be subject to decisions based solely on automated processing that significantly affects you.

consent.title: 3.1 Consent
consent.content: We process your personal data based on your explicit consent, which you can withdraw at any time.

contract.title: 3.2 Contract
contract.content: We process your personal data to perform our contractual obligations to you.

legalObligation.title: 3.3 Legal Obligation
legalObligation.content: We process your personal data to comply with legal obligations, such as Swiss invoicing regulations.

legitimateInterests.title: 3.4 Legitimate Interests
legitimateInterests.content: We process your personal data based on our legitimate interests, balanced against your rights and freedoms.

dataMinimization.title: 4.1 Data Minimization
dataMinimization.content: We only collect and process personal data that is necessary for the specified purposes.

purposeLimitation.title: 4.2 Purpose Limitation
purposeLimitation.content: We process personal data only for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes.

storageLimitation.title: 4.3 Storage Limitation
storageLimitation.content: We retain personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected.

accuracy.title: 4.4 Accuracy
accuracy.content: We take reasonable steps to ensure personal data is accurate and up to date.

dataBreaches.title: 5. Data Breach Notification
dataBreaches.content: In the event of a personal data breach that is likely to result in a high risk to your rights and freedoms, we will notify you without undue delay and within 72 hours of becoming aware of the breach.

dataProtectionOfficer.title: 6. Data Protection Officer
dataProtectionOfficer.content: We have appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who can be contacted at privacy@paymatch.app for any questions regarding data protection and your rights under GDPR.

internationalTransfers.title: 7. International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: When we transfer your personal data outside the European Economic Area, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, such as adequacy decisions, standard contractual clauses, or binding corporate rules.

complaints.title: 8. Right to Complain
complaints.content: You have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority if you believe we have not handled your personal data in accordance with GDPR. In Switzerland, you can contact the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).

contact.title: 9. Contact Us About GDPR
contact.content: If you have any questions about your rights under GDPR or our data processing practices, please contact us at privacy@paymatch.app or write to us at Maxapp ZRH, Birkenstrasse 49, 6343 Rotkreuz, Schweiz.
